cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep inland across the Southeast U.S. and move offshore of North Carolina into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Panama City, Florida (Florida Panhandle)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown, FL and from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass, FL to Clearwater Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–FL), inland Southeast states, then coastal North Carolina and adjacent Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with occasional gale-force gusts possible late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Chesapeake Bay for this event
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Sunday through Monday
